intro: Psychotria spithamea subsp. mossoensis, commonly known as the Mosso's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It often grows in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. The species is noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids, though it is not as well-studied as other Psychotria species.
